author: Michael Tucker
creator: Michael Tucker
description: “Lessons from the Screenplay” creator Michael Tucker and the LFTS team do deeper dives into the storytelling of individual movies and chat with the creatives behind those films.

items.content: We're launching our fall season, "Auteur Autumn" with a new episode releasing every Friday. We're going to examine some of our most iconic directors' unique styles and voices by looking at an early film from their portfolio and then a new film that they have coming out. October 13: Se7en (David Fincher) October 20: Shutter Island (Martin Scorsese) October 27: Patreon-Exclusive — Killers of the Flower Moon (Martin Scorsese) November 03: Virgin Suicides (Sofia Coppola) November 10: Priscilla (Sofia Coppola) November 17: The Killer (David Fincher) November 24: Patreon-Exclusive — Prometheus (Ridley Scott) December 1: Napoleon (Ridley Scott) 🎧 Listen to our patron-exclusive episode on Rear Window: https://www.patreon.com/posts/patron-exclusive-89996529 🎬 Join our community! Head to the Beyond the Screenplay Patreon: ⁠⁠⁠https://www.patreon.com/beyondthescreenplay⁠⁠⁠ 👕 BEYOND THE SCREENPLAY MERCH ⁠⁠⁠https://lessons-from-the-screenplay.creator-spring.com⁠⁠⁠ ☕️ LFTS Merch: ⁠⁠⁠https://standard.tv/collections/lfts⁠⁠⁠ Find us on Twitter Beyond the Screenplay: ⁠⁠⁠https://twitter.com/BTScreenplay⁠⁠⁠ Michael Tucker: ⁠⁠⁠https://twitter.com/michaeltuckerla⁠⁠⁠ Tricia Aurand: ⁠⁠⁠https://twitter.com/TriciaJeanA⁠⁠⁠ Brian Bitner: ⁠⁠⁠https://twitter.com/BrianBitner⁠⁠⁠ Alex Calleros: ⁠⁠⁠https://twitter.com/Alex_Calleros⁠⁠⁠ Produced by Vince Major: ⁠⁠⁠https://twitter.com/VinceMajor⁠⁠⁠ Website: ⁠⁠⁠http://beyondthescreenplay.com⁠⁠⁠ For Inquiries and Booking: ⁠⁠⁠Vince@Plusfortyseven.com
items.contentSnippet:
We're launching our fall season, "Auteur Autumn" with a new episode releasing every Friday.

We're going to examine some of our most iconic directors' unique styles and voices by looking at an early film from their portfolio and then a new film that they have coming out.

October 13: Se7en (David Fincher)
October 20: Shutter Island (Martin Scorsese)
October 27: Patreon-Exclusive — Killers of the Flower Moon (Martin Scorsese)
November 03: Virgin Suicides (Sofia Coppola)
November 10: Priscilla (Sofia Coppola)
November 17: The Killer (David Fincher)
November 24: Patreon-Exclusive — Prometheus (Ridley Scott)
December 1: Napoleon (Ridley Scott)

🎧 Listen to our patron-exclusive episode on Rear Window: https://www.patreon.com/posts/patron-exclusive-89996529
🎬 Join our community! Head to the Beyond the Screenplay Patreon: ⁠⁠⁠https://www.patreon.com/beyondthescreenplay⁠⁠⁠
👕 BEYOND THE SCREENPLAY MERCH ⁠⁠⁠https://lessons-from-the-screenplay.creator-spring.com⁠⁠⁠
☕️ LFTS Merch: ⁠⁠⁠https://standard.tv/collections/lfts⁠⁠⁠

Find us on Twitter

Website: ⁠⁠⁠http://beyondthescreenplay.com⁠⁠⁠
For Inquiries and Booking: ⁠⁠⁠Vince@Plusfortyseven.com

items.title: Patreon Preview: Dazed and Confused

items.content:
In our season finale, the BTS team discusses the juxtaposition between Barbieland and the real world, the similar conflict between Barbie and Ken's character arcs, and how Greta Gerwig manages to take a movie about Barbie and make it as thematically rich as it is pink.

🚀 Sign up for MUBI today using https://mubi.com/beyondthescreenplay to get 30 days of great cinema for free.

items.title: Patreon Preview: Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One

WORK_OF_ART: Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One

items.content:

items.title: Patreon Preview: Asteroid City

items.content:
The BTS team discusses the film that launched a multi-billion dollar movie franchise—Brian De Palma's stylish direction, the paranoia and distrust at the heart of the plot, and why the vault mission may be the greatest heist sequence of all time.

items.title: Patreon Preview: Speed

items.content: We're launching a special summer season called "Summer: Impossible" with a new episode releasing every week, a deep dive into the entire Mission: Impossible Franchise, and a big finale showdown between two of this year’s most anticipated films. Schedule: June 9th: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse June 16th: Mission Impossible June 23rd: Patron-Exclusive: Asteroid City or Elemental (determined by 🗳️Patreon vote) June 24th, 4pm: Mission: Impossible 2 Patreon Discord Watch-along June 30th: Mission: Impossible 3/4 July 7th: Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny July 14th: Mission: Impossible 5/6 July 21st: Patron-Exclusive: Mission: Impossible: Dead Reckoning - Part 1 July 28th: Barbie or Oppenheimer (determined by 🗳️ Patreon vote) 🎧 Listen to our patron-exclusive episode on Speed: https://www.patreon.com/posts/patron-exclusive-83857279 🎬 Join our community! June 16th: Mission Impossible

July 7th: Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny

items.content:
The BTS team counts down our favorite films of the 1980s, discusses the strange turn pop culture took during this decade, and why some of us may—or may not—have an affinity for the films of this era.

items.title: Patreon Preview: 10 Things I Hate About You

items.content:
The BTS team discusses how the original Rocky started it all by ensuring character comes first, how Creed rebooted the franchise by being its own movie while still being true to the original, and how both films deftly explore the concept of want vs. need.


🚀 Sign up for MUBI today using https://mubi.com/beyondthescreenplay to get 30 days of great cinema for free.

items.title: Episode 152: Rocky vs. Creed

items.content:
The BTS team discusses The Breakfast Club's archetypal-yet-three-dimensional cast of characters, the antagonist handoff at the film's midpoint, and the story manages to be so compelling despite its small scope and single setting.


🚀 Sign up for MUBI today using https://mubi.com/beyondthescreenplay to get 30 days of great cinema for free.

items.content:
John Truby (author of one of our favorite screenwriting books, The Anatomy of Story) joins us to talk about his new book, The Anatomy of Genres. We chat about movies and breakdown why people don't talk enough about genre, if they talk about it at all.


📖 Get The Anatomy of Genres (Amazon Affiliate Link): https://amzn.to/3gPuCpy

🚀 Head to John Truby's website: http://anatomyofgenres.com

items.title: Episode 139: Lady Bird

items.content:
The BTS team discusses how Ridley Scott's masterpiece manages to work despite ignoring several common screenwriting rules, the unforgettable tone set by H.R. Giger's amazing designs combined with the production and direction, and Ripley's slow reveal as the film's protagonist.


🚀 Head to Storyblocks today using http://storyblocks.com/beyondthescreenplay to sign up for their Unlimited All Access Plan.

items.title: Episode 138: Alien

items.content:
Part of the BTS team is joined by Tom Van der Linden and Thomas Flight, co-hosts of the podcast Cinema of Meaning, to discuss Gladiator: its many fascinating themes, the construction of Maximus as a protagonist, and what makes all the swordplay meaningful as well as thrilling.


🚀 Head to Storyblocks today using http://storyblocks.com/beyondthescreenplay to sign up for their Unlimited All Access Plan.

The BTS team discusses the film's strong theme, how the character web is designed to challenge the belief systems of the three central characters, and what makes Up in the Air feel like a lost 1990's movie.

items.content:
In this first episode of a patron-exclusive mini-series, the BTS team discusses the challenges in adapting the books to the screen, the differences between sociological and psychological storytelling, and their expectations and initial reactions to these first two episodes.

To listen to the upcoming weekly episodes on the AppleTV+ show, Foundation, support us on Patreon by signing up for a $5+ tier: https://www.patreon.com/beyondthescreenplay

The BTS team discusses Titanic's incredible cultural impact, Rose's characterization and moving character arc, and what it took for James Cameron to make the biggest disaster movie of all time.


Show Notes

Listen to our discussion of Loki Episode 5 on Patreon: https://bit.ly/3dXALLG

Listen to Brian's Missing Frame's episode on Titanic: https://www.thenerdparty.com/missingframes/episode-76-titanic

items.title: Episode 87: Titanic

items.content:
The BTS team welcomes back YouTube creator Patrick Willems to compare Forrest Gump and The Curious Case of Benjamin Button. The team discusses the films' strangely similar premises, dissects the movies' plot structures and filmmaking techniques, and debates the overall effectiveness of the stories' differing tones.


Show Notes

Patrick's video on Robert Zemeckis: https://youtu.be/JKe8qCzPdkI

Patrick Willems on Twitter: https://twitter.com/patrickhwillems

Listen to our discussion of Loki Episode 3 on Patreon: https://bit.ly/3hbxH0w


Tricia's movie recommendation: Bacurau (2019) by Kleber Mendonça Filho

items.title: Episode 66: Hidden Figures

items.content:

items.title: Episode 35: A Quiet Place

items.content:
The LFTS team (remotely!) discusses Parasite’s shocking midpoint reversal, how the film uses symbols and motifs to concretize abstract themes about class, and why a South Korean satire was able to resonate across the globe.


Sponsor

The first 500 listeners to use this link get 2 free months of Skillshare Premium Membership: https://skillshare.com/beyondthescreenplay

Once you sign up, look for Greg McKeown's class, "Simple Productivity: How to Accomplish More With Less."

The LFTS team breaks down the difference between the Arrival script and the short story, how the themes of communication and choice are woven throughout, and the power of film as its own language.

items.content:

items.title: Episode 23: Blade Runner

items.content:
The LFTS team discusses the psychological power of creepiness, whether or not the movie’s magic is intentional, and how the very process of writing can be terrifying.

items.title: Episode 17: Inglourious Basterds

items.content:
The LFTS team chats with YouTube creator and filmmaker Patrick (H) Willems about The Matrix's excellent storytelling, its exquisite production design, and why Keanu Reeves was the perfect Neo.

items.title: Episode 16: The Matrix (with Patrick (H) Willems)

WORK_OF_ART: Can't Get Enough of Keanu Podcast

items.content:
The LFTS team chats with the creators of YouTube channels Alt Shift X and Just Write about Game of Thrones. We discuss how the mode of storytelling changed in the later seasons, how we as creators approach creating content around for something as hotly debated as Game of Thrones, and how screenwriters and filmmakers should navigate this new world of social media and fan analysis content.


Alt Shift X: 

YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCveZqqGewoyPiacooywP5Ig

Twitter: https://twitter.com/AltShiftX 


Just Write:

YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/mythicalsage 

Twitter: https://twitter.com/SageHyden 


LFTS Game of Thrones Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jgZXDeGjf84 

Beyond the Screenplay Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/beyondthescreenplay 

LFTS Merch: https://standard.tv/collections/lfts


References:

Article on Sociological Storytelling in Game of Thrones: https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/observations/the-real-reason-fans-hate-the-last-season-of-game-of-thrones/ 

Lindsay Ellis video on Game of Thrones: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hys_m3BPTS8


Find us on Twitter

Beyond the Screenplay: https://twitter.com/BTScreenplay

Michael Tucker: https://twitter.com/michaeltuckerla

Tricia Aurand: https://twitter.com/TriciaJeanA

Brian Bitner: https://twitter.com/BrianBitner

Alex Calleros: https://twitter.com/Alex_Calleros


Produced by Vince Major: https://twitter.com/VinceMajor

Edited by Eric Schneider: https://twitter.com/ImEricSchneider


Website: http://lessonsfromthescreenplay.com

For Inquiries and Booking: Vince@Plusfortyseven.com

items.title: Episode 8: Adaptation

items.content:
The LFTS team chats with video essayist and writer Lindsay Ellis about Independence Day. We discuss her video comparing Independence Day with War of the Worlds, disaster movies in a post-9/11 world, and the challenges of making videos about film on YouTube.

Lindsay Ellis's video Independence Day vs. War of the Worlds: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KioF1sTQFtE

LFTS Video on Independence Day: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-gu8GQOJhdA

Beyond the Screenplay Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/beyondthescreenplay

Twitter: https://twitter.com/thelindsayellis

items.title: Episode 4: Groundhog Day

items.content:
The LFTS team interviews Aneesh Chaganty and Sev Ohanian, co-writers of Searching (2018), about how they took a traditional thriller story and adapted it to take place entirely on screens, their rigorous approach to collaboration and feedback, and the importance of dis-identifying with your work.


Searching LFTS Episode: https://youtu.be/bVFHAvnfW1A

Beyond the Screenplay Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/beyondthescreenplay


Sponsor:

items.contentSnippet:
The LFTS team interviews Aneesh Chaganty and Sev Ohanian, co-writers of Searching (2018), about how they took a traditional thriller story and adapted it to take place entirely on screens, their rigorous approach to collaboration and feedback, and the importance of dis-identifying with your work.

Searching LFTS Episode: https://youtu.be/bVFHAvnfW1A

items.content:
The LFTS team discusses The Devil Wears Prada (2006) and how it efficiently sets up its story in the first ten pages, the long process most scripts go through to become great, and determine that casting Meryl Streep in your movie is a good idea.


The Devil Wears Prada LFTS Video: https://youtu.be/-WgzNFEu61o

The Devil Wears Prada Screenplay: https://johnaugust.com/Assets/DEVIL_WEARS_PRADA_Full_Script.pdf

items.content:
The LFTS team discusses Shaun of the Dead (2005) and how story should come from character, the similarities between horror and comedy, and the movies that scared us as kids.


Shaun of the Dead LFTS Episode: https://youtu.be/mzqDiSr4jY4

Shaun of the Dead Screenplay: https://www.dropbox.com/s/0xmqwcfxa6xqm18/ShaunOfTheDead.pdf
